captions.text:
When travelling in London Town
it's easy to raise a frown

so please do try not to forget
these simple rules of etiquette

Platforms are really quite long
so it just seems rather wrong

to stand together in one place
(with someone's backpack in your face).

By moving down a little more
you'll be much quicker through the door.

Now the pushy-type that jumps aboard
right ahead of the travelling hoard

refuses to let others out
(even though they scream and shout)

is someone who deserves up out pity for not
knowing how to travel in this city

And whilst it's tempting to obstruct the doors
you should know what this can cause

it doesn't just delay the train,
but can mean damage, hurt and pain.

Now we don't mean to chide
but try to move along inside

so fellow travellers won't have to face
an invasion of their personal space.

And when feeling sick or suffering pain,
it's tempting to try to stop the train.

but reaching out for the alarm
can actually cause a lot more harm.

It takes us longer to get to you
and stops the trains from going through.

So that's the simple explanation
why you should wait until the station.

We love those papers you get for free
but, we're sure that you'll agree,

that love very quickly turns to hate
if they block the doors and make us late.

So, and this is just to let you know,
take them with you when you go.

Could all travellers take heed,
and offer seats to those in need.

We know that may seem rather bold
but please don't wait until you're told.

Now all this isn't meant to preach,
just to remind, inform and teach.

Because, and we don't mean to flatter.
To us, all your journeys matter.
